item.title: The U.S. Government Wants to Crack Down on Olive Oil Fraud
item.description:
The U.S. Government Wants to Crack Down on Olive Oil Fraud

Back in March, Italian lawmakers stepped up their efforts to combat olive oil fraud, which has ties to the mafia and damages the reputation of one of Italy's biggest exports. According to a report by the Olive Oil Times, American lawmakers are now making similar efforts, with the House Agricultural Committee directing the FDA to create a sampling and testing system for imported oils.

item.title: Watch: How to Cook Falafel With Zero Noisy Distractions
item.description:
Watch: How to Cook Falafel With Zero Noisy Distractions

This video from the aptly named YouTube Channel "Silently Cooking" offers a calming tutorial on how to cook falafel. There's no talkative host or flashy graphics, just sharp camera angles and the satisfying sounds of chickpea fritters frying away in oil.

item.title: Welcome to the World, Lewis-Clark Valley AVA!
item.description:
Welcome to the World, Lewis-Clark Valley AVA!

Welcome to the World, Lewis-Clark Valley AVA! This week the TTB approved a new AVA-the Lewis-Clark Valley AVA. The new American Viticultural Area will become official on May 20, 2016. The Lewis-Clark AVA surrounds the area where the Clearwater River runs into the Snake River-before the Snake River meets the Columbia on its way to the Pacific Ocean.

item.title: 5 Reasons Napa's Ca' Momi is Obsessively Authentic
item.description:
5 Reasons Napa's Ca' Momi is Obsessively Authentic

Saint Helena and Yountville no longer can lay claim to harboring the best of Napa Valley's restaurants. In recent years, Napa proper has seen an upsurge in the number and quality of eateries staking territory in the quaint riverside downtown area.

item.title: Guide to BottleRock
item.description:
Guide to BottleRock

You go to Napa for its world-class wine and food. Pair that with top musicians, and you have BottleRock Napa Valley. If you haven't been, an unforgettable weekend in a gorgeous setting awaits just an hour north of here.

item.title: Big Rick Joins Napa's 99.3 The Vine
Napa's enticing Ca' Momi Osteria
item.description:
Napa's enticing Ca' Momi Osteria

Everything tastes better deep fried, so the saying goes. So naturally I was intrigued when Ca' Momi Osteria owner and master pizzaiolo Dario De Conti decided to take his already marvelous pies, and dunk them in sizzling oil.

item.title: Why Wild, Chemical-Free, "Natural" Wines Are Taking the Industry by Storm
item.description:
Why Wild, Chemical-Free, "Natural" Wines Are Taking the Industry by Storm

From Paris to Tokyo to Copenhagen to Brooklyn, wines made with little to no chemical intervention-so-called natural wines-are the toast of the cognoscenti. Large, wet snowflakes started to fall just as I left Paris, and by the time the car rolled through the medieval city of Blois, with its sharp spires, the whole of the Loire Valley wore a cloak of fog.

item.title: A Weekend in the Wine Country: Yountville, California
item.description:
A Weekend in the Wine Country: Yountville, California

It was a gorgeous scene--rolling hills of grapevines laid before us, half covered by the early morning fog, half painted by the sun's diffused light. It was dreamy and it was picture perfect; and more than enough to make getting up very early on a Saturday worth it.
